meanings.definition: In a contrary or stubborn manner.
meanings.sent1: She frowardly refused to listen to any advice.
meanings.sent2: He always behaves frowardly when asked to follow instructions.
meanings.sent3: The cat frowardly ignored the new toy, preferring the old one.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds moved frowardly across the sky, blocking the sun.
meanings.sent5: The child stomped frowardly, arms crossed, when told it was bedtime.

meanings.definition: Showing a willful or stubborn opposition.
meanings.sent1: The frowardly student refused to participate in group activities.
meanings.sent2: Her frowardly attitude made it difficult to work with her on the project.
meanings.sent3: The frowardly squirrel kept stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood frowardly against the strong winds, refusing to bend.
meanings.sent5: The frowardly horse refused to be ridden, no matter how much coaxing was done.
